channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @TheRaDR @TransLawCenter But: The antisemitic transphobic conspiracy theory they laundered has in fact led to antisemitic violence here in New Jersey. https://t.co/JeRPmpfFkT
@HayimBrody @ZacharyBraiterm And stop retweeting then rather than sharing screenshots.
@MisfitTorah @DavidRSelis I mean, it’s not like this conspiracy theory sparked an antisemitic attack in your home town. Well, none since September, at least. https://t.co/JeRPmpxgcr
@rmneiss Do mainline funders give to Tablet? Isn’t it all Tikvah Fund money?

@dzkalman They’re something to be said to selling it to every NT professor at this price and then slashing it for a pb edition in five years for the amcha.
@dzkalman I am sad that my snark on the even pricier feminist Talmud commentary series didn’t make it into the piece.
@cstross One more and you’ll no longer be able to count them (in binary) on the fingers of one hand.
Noteworthy. https://t.co/xfHtrDuuCw
This. I would just add that it’s a sign of the party’s gerontocracy that nobody with decision making ability experiences the party’s inbox spam. https://t.co/spyy2yI1yh
@lavietidhar Growing increasing upset at George Washington and his fellow USexiters 250 years ago whose treason is keeping this beauty from our shores for the foreseeable future.
@froomkin The Cossacks work for the Czar.

@JYuter @yitzlandes Should YU have less religious freedom than for-profit Hobby Lobby? And it’s also possible that SCOTUS will separately overturn ban on funding religious institutions, rendering the non-sectarian rechartering moot.
@Merzmensch @OpenAI Also, Salvador.
@jnack @dbonneville @Merzmensch @OpenAI So there’s good precedent!
@PopulismUpdates Won’t this cause a temporal flight to Switzerland?
@DonielWeinreich @yu_commentator The scary thing is I might have it in my files somewhere….
Saving for our #JewsInSpace file. https://t.co/qKbnwwjBH8
@DonielWeinreich @yu_commentator Could I have read it in a Cordozo student paper that made its way uptown?
@lex_nyc @AkivaMCohen My money is on Yeshiva winning yet another horrible Supreme Court decision. Lots of culture warriors willing to spend big money to give YU a victory on this.
@DonielWeinreich @yu_commentator So that piece seems to have missed the article I read in '82 or '83.

@DavidRSelis My dad, now living back in his home town of Atlanta, befriended the husband of the author’s granddaughter. Who gave him one, knowing of my father’s interest in things Jewish — and particularly Haggadahs and Southern Jewry.
@DavidRSelis My dad promised to mail it to me, so you can expect more photos.

A post for my manuscript/American Jewish printing history friends. https://t.co/YqOFCyVb2S
A custom Haggadah, produced in a Reform congregation in North Carolina in 1936. https://t.co/iNU5PGNrqP
Apparently, includes text cut and pasted from the Union Haggadah. Interesting that a Reform congregation is observing two Seders.
Or perhaps earlier. My father, who just came in possession of the work just emailed me a link to a fascinating article on the small Mississippi town where Rabbi Tolochko moved to after North Carolina. https://t.co/PNVPtpGFdk
@DavidRSelis Oh, this tracks with a certain kind of idiosyncratic religious conviction that I occasionally seen in my slush pile.
@AryehBrus @modoxbrowngirl RIETS and JTS are seminaries. This looks like a yeshiva.
@AkivaMCohen Why not? Doesn’t a “non-religious” corporation still have federal First Amendment rights?
@AkivaMCohen Wouldn’t this put the NYC definition in conflict with Hobby Lobby, if YU wants to make a federal case out of it?
